source: #### Notebook to rebuild all workspace tables in a DR situation
import pprint
##### Define storage containers
storage_account = mssparkutils.notebook.run('/utils/py_utils_get_storage_account')
storage_account

standardised_container = 'odw-standardised'
harmonised_container = 'odw-harmonised'
curated_container = 'odw-curated'
curated_migration_container = 'odw-curated-migration'
config_container = 'odw-config-db'
logging_container = 'logging'

def list_tables(db_name: str):
    spark.sql(f"USE {db_name}")
    tables_df: DataFrame = spark.sql("SHOW TABLES")
    table_names: list = [row['tableName'] for row in tables_df.collect()]
    
    return table_names

For all databases, the tables and their metadata need to be extracted in advance of the DR test and hardcoded into this notebook as the information can't be obtained once the workspace is destroyed. Some of this is already in config in the repos but not all. After this DR test, having this all in config in the right format will be better so we just rebuild from there.
##### Rebuild standardised tables

db_name = "odw_standardised_db"
tables = list_tables(db_name=db_name)
table_metadata = create_table_metadata(container=standardised_container, db_name=db_name, tables=tables)

standardised_metadata = {'odw_standardised_db.aie_document_data': {'format': 'delta',
